defs: to tell, narrate or convey one's idea in spoken words.
to over or coat with a soft adhesive matter; to smear; to daub.
to rub; to scratch; to scrap; to test (metals like gold etc.) by rubbing on a touch-stone.
to examine; to analyse.
to add grace to; to improve the elegance of.
to kill (an insect as louse etc.) by rubbing (on the ground or any other surface).
to be attached or joined to.
ಒರೆಕೊಳ್ಳು oreoḷḷu to extend itself, be extended or expanded (as fire); to spread; 2. to anoint oneself with.
to flow or leak out slowly; to seep; to ooze.
to come forth; to be emitted; to be discharged or discharge oneself.
that which is said or narrated; narration.
something taught; instruction; teaching.
a rubbing or drawing of a line by rubbing; a method of testing the purity of gold and silver pieces using a touchstone and the goldsmith's needle.
the brightness or brilliance got by rubbing (an article of gold on touchstone).
(fig.) any test of genuineness or value.

ಒರೆಗೆ ಹಚ್ಚು orege haccu to test a small piece of gold or silver using with a touchstone a other piece of those metals (of known or standard fineness); 2. to subject to severe test to assess the real worth, value or sincerity; ಒರೆಗೆ ಹತ್ತು orege hattu (a silver or gold piece) to undergo purity-test; 2. (fig.) to undergo a test of one's purity, value or worth.
a case for the blade of a knife, sword, etc.; a sheath.
the condition or state of being the same in power, value, rank, status etc.; equality.
the state or quality of being similar; similarity; likeness.
small strip of gold or silver of known or standard fineness used with a touchstone in testing the purity of other pieces of those metals; a goldsmith's needle.
to enter into competition with another (to prove one's merit, strength etc.).
to be or become equal in status, rank, merit, strength, importance, etc.
to compete, vie for superiority; to fight.
= ಒರೆಗಲ್ಲು.
a type of black stone formerly used to test the purity of gold or silver by the streak left on it when it was rubbed with the metal; a touchstone.

to take out (a knife, sword, etc.) from the sheath.

a man who tests the purity of gold or silver by rubbing it on a touch stone.

an inner room in a relatively huge building as a palace.
to know, understand the secret, intention etc.
the revelation of the inner secret, mystery; the knowledge of the self.
(fig.) spiritual ignorance.
to bring or cause to come under one's control; to subject to.
to become subject to another's control, jurisdiction, etc.
to be included in; to become a part of.
to join hands; to help or support.
to know, understand the secret, intention etc.
the part of the ear in the temporal bone consisting of the semicircular canal, vestibule, and cochlea.
the supposed ability to perceive or sense sounds that are not perceptible to the normal human ears.
an interior or internal part or place; inside.
the element or complex of elements in an individual that feels, perceives, thinks, wills, and especially reasons; the mind.

something kept hidden or unexplained; something kept from the knowledge of others or shared only confidentially with a few; a method, formula or process used in an art or a manufacturing operation and divulged only to those of one's own company or craft; a secret.
the state or condition of being under the control of another.

ಒಳಗುಮಾಡಿಕೊ(ಳ್ಳು) oḷagumaḍiko(ḷḷu) 1. to include; to bring within as a part; 2. to bring under one's control or jurisdiction; 3. to entice by promise of pleasure or gain, usu. to do something secretly wrong or illegal; ಒಳಗು ಹೊರಗು oḷagu horagu (used in pl.) all the details (of a procedure etc.); ins and outs of; ಒಳಗೆಹಾಕಿಕೊ(ಳ್ಳು) oḷaguhākiko(ḷḷu) = ಒಳಗುಮಾಡಿಕೊ(ಳ್ಳು) - 3.
to see and understand clearly the inner nature of things; to have intuition.
= ಒಳಗುಗೊಡು.
